title: Create vim API mocks for unit testing without Neovim dependency
description: Create a comprehensive mock module that provides Neovim API stubs (nvim_create_buf, nvim_buf_set_lines, etc.) and vim globals so that unit tests can run without requiring Neovim. This will enable testing of modules like theme.lua, async.lua, and fuzzy.lua.

title: Decompose oversized ui.lua into focused modules
description:
Split ui.lua (1,407 lines) into specialized modules:
- ui_windows.lua: Float/sidebar window creation
- ui_rendering.lua: Task list formatting, tree building  
- ui_editor.lua: Task editor and creation interface
- ui_keymaps.lua: Keyboard bindings
- Keep core ui.lua as coordinator

This will improve maintainability and reduce module complexity.

title: Unify async and progress tracking systems
description:
Consolidate async.lua (436 lines) and progress.lua (286 lines) which have overlapping concerns:

Both track:
- status: running, completed, failed
- timestamps for operations
- info/stats methods

Solution: Have async.lua use progress.lua internally for tracking,
reducing duplication and improving consistency. Tests ensure
no behavioral changes.

title: Extract command validation and builder patterns
description:
Simplify commands.lua (416 lines) by extracting:

1. Common validation patterns (task_id, priority, etc.)
2. Command builder abstraction
3. Error handling boilerplate

Create command/validator.lua with reusable validators:
- validate_task_id(id)
- validate_priority(p)
- validate_status(s)

Create command/builder.lua with:
- build_command(name, description, callback, validators)

This reduces duplication and improves testability.

title: Improve error handling and add critical tests
description:
Address inconsistencies in error handling across 722 lines of code:

1. Standardize error checking patterns (if not result then vs if ok then)
2. Create error codes/types for different failure modes
3. Implement error propagation in callbacks
4. Add tests for:
   - Cache invalidation logic
   - Window creation and lifecycle
   - Command parsing and validation
   - Sync operations and error recovery
   - Template resolution and variable substitution

Target: Improve test coverage from current levels to 70%+ on critical modules.
